strategy: Try using a different random seed during the train-test split to ensure that any chance patterns in the data do not influence the results.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

train_data[categorical_cols] = train_data[categorical_cols].fillna(train_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])
test_data[categorical_cols] = test_data[categorical_cols].fillna(test_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])

scaler = StandardScaler()
train_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.fit_transform(train_data[numeric_cols])
test_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.transform(test_data[numeric_cols])

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression(random_state=42)  # Change random state for different splits
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

train_data[categorical_cols] = train_data[categorical_cols].fillna(train_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])
test_data[categorical_cols] = test_data[categorical_cols].fillna(test_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])

# Drop the 'SalePrice' column from the numeric_cols list if present
if 'SalePrice' in numeric_cols:
    numeric_cols.remove('SalePrice')

scaler = StandardScaler()
train_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.fit_transform(train_data[numeric_cols])
test_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.transform(test_data[numeric_cols])

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression(random_state=42)  # Change random state for different splits
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

train_data[categorical_cols] = train_data[categorical_cols].fillna(train_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])
test_data[categorical_cols] = test_data[categorical_cols].fillna(test_data[categorical_cols].mode().iloc[0])

if 'SalePrice' in numeric_cols:
    numeric_cols.remove('SalePrice')

scaler = StandardScaler()
train_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.fit_transform(train_data[numeric_cols])
test_data[numeric_cols] = scaler.transform(test_data[numeric_cols])

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_cols:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    train_data[col] = le.fit_transform(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = le.transform(test_data[col])
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_cols:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    train_data[col] = le.fit_transform(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = le.transform(test_data[col], y=train_data[col])  # Ensure consistency
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_cols:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    train_data[col] = le.fit_transform(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = le.transform(test_data[col])
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
numeric_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_cols = train_data.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values
train_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test_data.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
for col in categorical_cols:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    train_data[col] = le.fit_transform(train_data[col])
    test_data[col] = le.transform(test_data[col])
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Split data into features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Make predictions
predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

print(f'R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, model.predict(X_train))}')
ENDOFFILE
